I give it 4 stars because the place is crowded and there is always a wait.  I have had salads, chicken dishes, pizza small plates, soups, etc.  Everything I have had has been very good.  I like the Chicken Marsala with soft breasts of white chicken and fine Marsala wine sauce.  The portions are generous and I usually take half home with me.  Their soups are fresh and not too salty.  I have had their pea soup with half a sandwich.  I have had chicken Piccatta, which was yummy.  I had their Chinese chicken Salad which, for me is huge.  Even their half order is a generous portion.  I tasted a friend's Thai salad which was great.  I have eaten at both their Beverly Hills and Westwood locations.  Both have the same healthy food.  CPK it is!

Cedar Plank Salmon is the only thing I've ordered for the past 2 years. Started coming here for the BBQ Chicken Pizza, years ago. It's still good... from what I hear. But now, that salmon dish got me like... Dope staff as well. Nicest people in Beverly Hills. Always a pleasure to come through and have a good dinner here. My favorite spot.

Met my cousin here for lunch recently, and we both ordered a half portion of their roasted veggie salad, in which I added some grilled chicken.  I love this salad, and I love even more that their half portion is quite filling and plentiful.  In addition to lots of lettuce, this salad comes with roasted bell peppers, asparagus, eggplant, artichoke hearts, and avocado (plus the chicken).  Lots of my favorite things, all with great flavor.  It comes with a Dijon vinaigrette dressing, but I don't always love that...... sometimes it just comes out too sweet.  I'm not really sure where the Dijon part is, but it's definitely heavy on the balsamic vinegar flavor, which is just okay.  Still and all, I love the salad. Location is south of Wilshire on Beverly Blvd, so it's a little easier to manage parking wise.  At a minimum, there is a garage directly across the street, and the first 2 hours are free.  If you are into a sweet finish to a meal, go a few steps around the corner from here, and you're at 'Lette Macarons.  All you foodies out there already know the place, but for those of you who don't, go find out why I mention them.  Anyway, I digress......... CPK is always a nice, reliable chain option for lunch in the ultra chic and expensive Beverly Hills.

My wife and I visited this place on the eve of Valentine's day which was also our 6th anniversary.  We loved the place and the food and drinks were stupendous. The guy who served us was very gentle and spent a very good time to explain on various items. My wife and I have become fan of CPK and will be visiting the place quite often from now onwards.

This particular location seems to do a better job than the one I usually go to in Culver City. The BBQ Chicken salad and the pizza were both very good, The waiter did drop the ball a little but nothing over the top as he corrected his mistake.
5 star rating strictly for the consistently great service provided by Will and Ben!!

The food is always what you expect. Not great food but consistent. Great for lunch and families with young kids. My biggest complaint with this BH location is that the restaurant always smells like a dirty mop so we tend to sit outside

First time ever eating a CPK and I was not disappointed. TONS of different pizza choices and there's something for everyone. Whether you're a meat eater, vegetarian, or just fussy I can promise you'll find something that appeals to you. I was actually surprised at the interesting cocktail list too! And our waitress was SO friendly. Can't complain.

maybe my expectations where high but the food is really just bland.  the service is great but the food is the reason to go to a restaurant, not the service.   though if not for the service, the review would be a one star.

Good, sometimes. Service is consistent as you would expect from somewhere so corporate. Portion size good for the price but a little bland overall. Too much sugar in their sauces, drinks, and salad dressings! Sometimes causes a craving for bbq chicken......!

We went here with our 3 "little" kids and it was "good". So def family friendly. Free wifi (so you can keep kids busy on smart phones, tablets). Kids meal were good and fast. Nice staff. Paper and crayons for kids. So overall good experience.

One star is far too kind for what was once a quality, new taste kind of restaurant. Whoever the "genius" is that decided to first, stop chopping up their salads, then change the high quality real turkey breast for lunch meat that I have seen better quality in the cold section at 7-11 should be held accountable for not only loosing $3000 - $5000 per year of my business but for taking one of the items that put this place on the map and moved it all the way to the trash. I know the new "owners" who are really capital investors are looking to make a buck by switching quality for crap and thinking their customers are too stupid. Or do they just want customers who expect lesser quality. Thanks "Golden Gate Capital" for helping me decide never to eat at CPK ever again. In fact I even watched your waiters turn away 2 family's 7 minutes before you stop serving in front of the manager with the excuse that their watch showed it was 5 minutes past the hour. This was so they could eat with their girlfriend and not have too work. "Way to go, great example set".  SAD.
Love that this restaurant is so conscious about keeping food free of cross contamination with allergens.  Hope that more restaurants will follow CPK's lead in the future.

I've been  going to this CPK location for years, but lately their service really gone down hill. The last few times we were there the servers took forever to attend to our table, although the restaurant was not busy at all. And just last week when I ordered for pick up they messed up my order and forgot the drinks. It really too bad, because it's so convenient... What happened CPK?

Although they're a tad bit greasy, I LOVE CPK's avocado club egg rolls.  Unfortunately, this particular CPK location does not have a deep fryer so you can't order them.  Not cool.  Not cool.   Other than the deep fryer issue, it's your typical CPK.  Salad, soups, pizzas, and entrees.  Been to one, been to all.
I like to come here once in a whole. I haven't tried anything that I haven't liked (yet). The service is outstanding. Very nice and not very expensive which is good for me. :)

I've been to other CPK's and have had far better experiences. We sat at our table for quite a while before anyone came to take our order, the bathroom was gross, and one of our two dishes was awful. I will definitely not be going back to this branch.

I'm not gonna comment on the food of CPK.  If you haven't dined at any of the nationwide chain locations by now, well you're either better than the rest of the nation, too foo foo or just clueless. Having said that, this location isn't my favorite.  You always have to flag down a waiter for *something*, their take-out service is slower than molasses and I just don't like the the table setup.  I realize that most CPK tables are crammed together but it doesn't mean I have to like it. Oh but their Waldorf chicken salad?  Yes, please.  (OK, one food comment.)
Busy and sometimes cramped.  Not very fast service. But yummy salads (Waldorf and Chinese chicken salad) and pizzas (white pizza, BBQ chicken) and pastas (garlic Alfredo with salmon). I'm a fan.
we order quite often from here for lunch.. and I have to say.. wow.. can ya lay off adding a whole onion to your salads and pasta dishes.. its a bit much.. wow.. will not order for awhile.... yuck...

The food at California Pizza Kitchen is consistent and good, and the prices are fair.  Other than that, I cannot say anything positive, especially about the Beverly Hills branch.   The tables are about an inch apart, the place is so noisy you almost cannot hear the horrible music they play and waiters seem to have a half-life of about a month.   The place looks and feels like McDonald's, down to the same yellow and the same mechanical service.  You will get exactly one piece of bread for each person, plus one for the table (2 people get 3 pieces).  Instead of the trademark, "would you like fries with that?" CPK tries to sell you dessert and coffee at lunch -- as if anyone would want to sit there and "enjoy' the atmosphere.   I've worked two blocks from this place for almost 20 years, and I pretty much refuse to go there, despite the decent food and prices.

Can't believe we came back here.  Again, terrible service.  3 of us were nicely greeted by the manager at the host stand and were promptly sat at a table.  We waited approximately 5 minutes and no server ever came to our table.  We were on a lunch hour so we didn't have a lot of time to kill waiting for someone to come.  I got up and asked the manager that sat us if there was anyone assigned to our table.  She came over and took our order because there must have been some mixup with who got which tables.  She came back a few minutes later and dropped the drinks off.  Nobody came by our tables from the time the drinks were dropped off to when the food was delivered.  The manager (which we assumed as acting as our server because nobody else ever came by) never came back asking if we needed anything/how we liked the food and never refilled our drinks.  A server (which we later found out was supposedly our server) dropped off the check and asked if we needed any boxes as he set down the check.  We all asked for refills since nobody ever came by as we were eating.  So we basically got our first refill the same time the bill was taken.  We paid with a gift card and asked for change with a $20 for the tip.  The gift card had $.52 left which was never returned and we were given $19 change instead of $20.  Over 5 minutes passed and nobody ever came back by, so we asked the bus boy to grab the manager.  She came by and made excuses as to why our server didn't return the gift card and why we were short changed.  This place really doesn't have their act together.  There were probably 5-6 tables of customers, and at least 12 employees.  The female manager (2/10/12 @ noon) was literally chit chatting with the employees throughout our entire meal - this is the root problem as to why our service was bad.

Haven't been back to CPK for the longest time.. I always loved their jambalaya (and chicken kung pao and bbq chicken pizza and tortilla soup).. anyway had the jambalaya.. but it was not as good as i remembered.. previously they have this little crawfish thingy and there's no more :( and also the sauce is a tad salty.. so sad.. anyway it's an average.. i'll prob be back once in a blue moon.. i also love their tiramisuuu yum.. i used to order a whole batch for party..

My roommate & I come here today (CPK) have lunch. I order a wed salad and the salad look like old & left over two (2) or there (3) days ago. The bacon was very bad look old & taste very bad. And it's not taste fresh what I thought. This place (CPK) should be here. My advice for every body save your money & go some where else not this (CPK) place. I order desert it was terrible & taste very bad old cake bake three (3)  week ago. They do not know how to serve to the public a fresh good food Would you agree that ?? That how you want people to serve you when you eat any where & any place when you go out is that right ?? food should be fresh is that difficult to ask for ?? I will never go back here again (CPK) this location !!! The manager she come out to talk to me & she give me an attitude what a b*tch she is. I hope after peoplea see this review & read my review so they won't come here to eat at this dirty place and cheat to public serve food that left over from yesterday. So no body find out now I said it. That this place serve food left over from yesterday to the customer that wrong !!!. Please do NOT come here (CPK)  to eat be very careful !!!. I went home and I get sick from their dirty kitchen. And food that was bad & old contaminate (food poison.) Don't eat here.

I've been told this is the original CPK!  Right smack dab in the middle of Beverly Hills!  The food is great, like any in this chain, but here you are likely to see a few celebs chomping away on shrimp scampi pizza or the chicken caesar salad.  There is also a high chance of sitting next to a bunch of rich bored Beverly Hills kids, or some really excited tourists...which is a little annoying.

My favorite CPK location, and the ORIGINAL!   I grew up around here so I have plenty of memories here.  I grew up with the growth of the company and I still love it. I have always liketd the pizza at CPK... even the pastas are tasty and their salads aren't bad either.    Now that I think about it, I even like their appetizers, although they are WAY overpriced whereas most items on the menu are an OK deal.  Don't be ordering a pepperoni or a plain cheese pizza, or God will kill a kitten for no reason. Let's be honest people... CPK invented the BBQ chicken pizza.  Every other pizza joint that has a BBQ chicken pizza is merely treading in the wake of the ORIGINAL.  --- Barbecue sauce instead of tomato sauce, smoked gouda cheese to give it a nice flavor, red onions, BBQ chicken, and cilantro.   I pray that you aren't one of those people who claims to dislike cilantro.  If you are, maybe you should order off the kids' menu...  My favorites: Their eggroll type appetizer with the dipping sauces Chinese chicken salad Thai pasta Carne Asada Pizza (probably has the most flavors going on) Sweet and spicy italian sausage pizza BBQ chicken pizza Some others I can't think of..... The pizza must be on the HONEY WHEAT DOUGH please. Stay away from the tostada pizza.  Lettuce (or anything WATERY, like fresh tomatos) on a pizza makes me want to kill myself.  And you best believe that before I die, I will take at least 100 kittens with me for no reason. The staff is always on their toes because bitchy Beverly Hills moms are very demanding when it comes to sending back pizzas, getting orders perfected, etc.   Therefore, for a normal customer, they are usually quite competent of taking care of your order.   Never in memory have I had bad service here. I also believe the cooks at S. Beverly Drive have been there for a really long time, because they put out consistently (which is the #1 most important factor) the best pizza of any CPK location I've tried.  You can see the experience in their technique. Another plus about this location is there's plenty of parking in a city lot nearby.  As well as ample street parking for most days.

I love California Pizza Kitchen.  I can't rate this location 5 stars because of the difficulty with the interior noise level.  There are so many families that visit this restaurant and because of the acoustics, the noise level is too high.  Along with that at times it feels as if I am eating a Chuck-E-Cheese with the children crying, running around and falling out of their chairs.  This is a very convenient place for the area and it is too bad it is not larger to accommodate the families in a family area.

With all of the agencies like William Morris in the area, this CPK is super busy during lunch hour...A client and I went here for a quick lunch and it was your typical CPK fare...I just read in another review that this may be the original CPK, which is cool...but there's nothing too out of the ordinary here.
It's okay. The service was pretty decent, but the food is your typical CPK quality. Mediocre food with a slightly-above-average presentation.

OH how I will never ever ever come back to this CPK ever again. I honestly love CPK but when I went to this one it absolutely changed my perspective. I ordered the lemon piccata salmon, spinach artichoke dip, and bbq chicken. Don't worry I shared with someone. LOL but anyway daaanng our food took about 20 minutes. I was about to eat the forks that were on the table. They didnt even consider giving us bread and butter. HOOOW RUDE! I even saw my serve just hanging out talking to her other HOMIES! OMG so when I get my lemon piccata salmon. EWWW on how raw the salmon was inside. I LOVE SALMON BUT NOT WHEN IT'S RAW. I couldn't eat it and she didn't even bother refilling my peach lemonade. OHH WELL SUCK IT CPK IN BEVERLY HILLS!!

terrible in every way. the service was bad. was in there for probably 15 minutes before the waiter even came to take the drink order. the food was subpar, to put it gently. i've been a few times, so i expected them to be busy and the food to be a little too greasy, as usual, but this time they took it to a new level. even the bread was stale and hard. i would not recommend this place at all. i ordered a pizza which was supposed to have chicken and avocado. it was mostly pizza with lettuce on top. there was some avocado but almost no chicken. the whole experience was simple awful and i wont be going back.

I ordered pickup for lunch one day and I got some of the appetizers.  It was decent.. but a bit greasy and the taste was a bit off... I couldn't put my finger on it.  Service was quick, place was clean, would I go back?  Maybe.. but maybe not.

Compared to my other CPK experience in Rancho Cucamonga, this location was MUCH better but still needs a little improvement.  9 of us stopped by for dinner and they quickly set up a table for us and get us started right away.  Food is typical of CPK (which is usually very yummy), and service here was pretty good.  The only thing is that each time that anyone in the group or I needed a refill, it took a while for us to catch the server's attention.  Other than that, it was a fairly good experience.  Love the BBQ Chicken Salad and the Spinach and Artichoke Dip. YUMMY

typical california pizza kitchen. the outdoor patio really is nice however you know that cars drive by and waiters aren't always around. The inside is great and servers are everywhere, and attentive. The small bites work great when you don't know what you want. This is just a great location in beverly hills and remember location location location. so if you want a fast bite this is a great go to place
I've been eating here since they first opened over 25 years ago. The food is always very good. I've never had a bad meal here. I've never had a bad meal at any CPK. I think it is an excellent chain.

So my sis and I came here after buying my mom her V-Day gift (a little diamond pinky ring from Beverly Hills Diamonds). We were taking in the scenery and saw CPK. We had to eat there, it was a lovely day and not crowded at all. As always I got the Penne pasta with extra sausage... It adds that little kick in my opinion and a glass of Merlot. It was delicious. I have eaten at a lot of CPK's and I have yet to be disappointed. The spring rolls are also a great appetizer and the service is always excellent. :)

Come one come all!!!!  You know what this populist "California" pizza tastes like if you've ever pulled it out of your grocer's freezer, and the fact remains that this chain of all chains scratches an itch like none other.  They're constantly updating their menu with cheesy, starchy goodness.  I just had the Buffalo Chicken pizza and if I was drunk or high, this monstrosity would've reinvented food.  As it stands, it was pretty damn good.

I am little unsure why this CPK doesn't have more stars, but I give it 5 stars.  I was addicted at one point to this place and went 2 times a week to get my fix.  I don't know what it is about this location, but the food is excellent.  You must try the miso salad with the crab and shrimp.  This salad is so good it's literally addicting.  I'm not sure whether or not it's the yummy Asian dressing, avocado, or the crispy noodles, but it's great!  Also, if you like a thin and crispy pizza, go for their classic the Sicilian.  It's consistently good.  As for service here, I always get the best service, they are really on top of their game here.

We live down the street from this location so we frequent it for dinner. However on our last visit, we found a hair in our salad so I gave it to our waiter and told him what we found and that we didn't want another one to replace it. A couple minutes later, the manager Esther walks over to the table and says, "Can you describe the hair that you found; was it long or short? Dark or light?" I looked at her with my jaw hanging open. She didn't waver in the silence and eventually said, "I want to know so that I can see who isn't wearing their hairnet." ARE YOU KIDDING ME? She didn't apologize for the incident ONCE. As if I wasn't disgusted enough by finding a hair in my salad, the manager is going to ask me to describe it in detail? And not try to make amends?! I was dumbfounded and cannot believe that someone in a management position would behave like that. Come on, CPK, they should know better. I'm so disappointed.

I don't care what other people say.  CPK is good.  They are always busy so that should tell you something.  It's a great spot for lunch or a casual dinner.  I've been there about 30 times and the food and service is always on point.  My favorite dish by far is the chicken waldorf salad followed by the Japanese veggie pizza on honey wheat crust.

My favorite pizza is the Carne Asada!  I love it.  You just can't go wrong.  All the ingredients fuse together and its like a party in your mouth!  If you want something sweet and delicious to wash down your pizza try the Red Velvet Cake.  It's out of this world!

The final tally at California Pizza Kitchen always takes me aback a bit and makes me want to paraphrase Dorothy: "We're not at a Chili's in Orlando, FL, anymore, Toto." Granted, CPK is more adventurous than your typical sit-down chain - a big plus - but I can't ever quite shake the feeling that I'm eating somewhere whose menu has been poured over and endlessly revised by corporate types and their overpaid "expert" gastronomic consultants (and why am I not one of those? Oh, right, because I have weak moments when I'm convinced that there doesn't exist a finer example of food than cheese puffs - an automatic disqualification, probably). Maybe that's why the food is always less exciting in your mouth than it was in the menu's description. This location is always bustling - I suspect CPK is a slumming Beverly Hillsian's version of grabbing a hot dog from 7-11 - but the service is always efficient, so whatever the wait, it never feels unnecessary.

CPK is a nice family restaurant. The food is really good, and it's one of my favorite pizza places in LA. However, there is often a 10-15 minute wait, and the service can be slow. Therefore, i would definitely recommend CPK to someone not in a hurry. However, if you are in a hurry, go to CPK ASAP which offers a rather speedy CPK meal.
